messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] New Foundation Study on Screen Time for Children ...
messages.msgSnippet: ... Yes, 59.00 at Sears for a 13 . That ones in the tv room, the monitor tv broke so we thought. Our old Br tv is in the 4yo room so she can watch her tapes as
messages.messageBody:
>Are TVs cheaper in the US? In the UK do you pay special taxes on the TV
>set?Betsy>>>>

Yes,
59.00 at Sears for a 13". That ones in the tv room, the monitor tv broke so
we thought. Our old Br tv is in the 4yo room so she can watch her tapes as the
tv room no longer has a VCR. We did buy our oldest a tv years ago and he has
the Xbox for DVD's and can move to the tv room if he chooses. Our bedroom has
the 27" so we can see it and a VCR/DVD combo that the kids use. It has taken
several years to get them all but they are here for use when wanted.

There is a big price jump on products in the UK. Once when I had my .com a
customer called from the UK and wanted a Baby Jogger. Here they are 216.00 after
shipping and cost he was looking at 700.00. He said they ran closer to 800
there.
Laura
>
>Are TVs cheaper in the US? In the UK do you pay special taxes on the TV
>set?
>
>Betsy


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
